cellularAutomata.graphics.colors
Class TaggedColorPool

java.lang.Object
  cellularAutomata.graphics.colors.TaggedColorPool
Direct Known Subclasses:
ColorScheme
public abstract class TaggedColorPool
extends java.lang.Object

Keeps track of colors used to tag cells for extra visibility. Each color is assigned to particular objects that can reserve (and release) those colors. For example, an analysis might wish to reserve a color. When the analysis closes, it can release that color.

Author:
David Bahr

Field Summary
static boolean taggedCellsNoExtraColor
          If true, tagged cells should be displayed with no extra color (invisible).
static boolean taggedCellsTranslucent
          If true, tagged cells should be displayed as translucent.
 
Constructor Summary
TaggedColorPool()
          Create a list of tagged colors that can be "checked out" by other classes.

If true, tagged cells should be displayed as translucent.

If true, tagged cells should be displayed with no extra color (invisible).

Constructor Detail

TaggedColorPool

public TaggedColorPool()
Create a list of tagged colors that can be "checked out" by other classes.

Method Detail

getTaggedColor

public java.awt.Color getTaggedColor(java.lang.Object taggingObject)
Gets a tagged color which depends on the object (usually an analysis) that tagged the cell. Each object is assigned a different tagged color. If there are not enough tagged colors for all of the tagging objects, then the default tagged color is used.

Parameters:
taggingObject - The object that tagged the cell (usually an analysis).
Returns:
The tagged color unique to the taggingObject (or if runs out of tagged colors, then the default tagged color is returned).

releaseTaggedColor

public static void releaseTaggedColor(java.lang.Object taggingObject)
Releases the tagged color that has been assigned to the taggingObject. This method is part of an "object pool" for tagged colors.

Parameters:
taggingObject - The object that was previously assigned a tagged color.

reserveTaggedColor

public static void reserveTaggedColor(java.lang.Object taggingObject)
Reserves a tagged color that will be associated with the taggingObject. Reserved colors must later be returned or released with the releaseTaggedColor() method. This method is part of an "object pool" for tagged colors.

Parameters:
taggingObject - The object that will be assigned a tagged color.
